Characterization assay was through HPLC analysis. Bacterial enzymes showed 87% ZEA degradation efficiency
Nine enzymes were identified in the study; enzymes belong to F420H2 dependent reductase (FDR‐A and ‐B) families (enzymes that depend on F420H2 as a cofactor)
Saccharomyces sensu stricto are a series of different yeast strains, not just one specfic species. These different strains could have different natural environments.

Specific Aspergillus species focused on are A. clavatus, A. ochraceus, A. versicolor, and A. wentii. Found in widespread environments, not just soil.

Three experimental preparations of viable bacteria, cell free supernatant and bacterionin prep were analyzed in their ability to remove or decrease levels of mycotoxin. The strongest inhibition of growth and toxin production was observed in the presence of cultures containing viable cells and supernatants obtained from propionibacteria cultures.

The enzyme responsible for the B subtilis strain UTBSP1-caused decrease in Aflotoxin mycotoxin is an extracellular constituively produced enzyme. When preparations UTBSP1 were analyzed in nutrient broth culture, in the pistachio nut and cel-free supernatant, it was found that cell-free supernatant had an efficacy rate of 78.39% decrease in AFB1 content while the other two preparations had 86% and 95% decreases.

The actual pathway that the MnP enzyme took to degrade AFB1 (aflatoxin B1) was observed through 1H-NMR and HR-ESI-MS analysis. They found that AFB1 is first oxidized to AFB1-8,9-epoxide by MnP and then hydrolyzed to AFB1-8,9-dihydrodiol which is non-toxic and non-carcinogenic.
E. coli DH5α was used as the host for constructing recombinant plasmids containing degrading gene(s); concentration of zearalenone in olutions was determined w/ HPLC

enzymes couldn’t be identified but possess a broad reaction temperature range, pH tolerance, and excellent thermostability which makes them potentially useful for degrading AF from the human diet and animal feed
mechanistically this paper lookad both biotransformation and adsorption and saw results for both.
Degradation appears to be intracellular with unknown enzyme; charaacterization context is live culture
Whether the process is enzymatic is unknown at this time; CC was live culture
Removal mechanism seems to be inhibition of molds that produce B1

strains mediate OTA biodegradation under anaerobic conditions, may be suitable as silage inoculants or as feed additives

used intracellular extracts which showed ability of induced and constitutive enzymes to completely stop genotoxicity of AFB1 within minutes while constitituve enzymes alone took 6 hours, has been a case of bloodstream infection caused by R. erythropolis in immunocompromised male
